snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include Zynga mistakenly sending its customer inquiries to someone outside the company and what that person does with...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday’s selections include Zynga mistakenly sending its customer inquiries to someone outside the company and what that person does with them, and the price of fake Twitter followers falling as the market grows.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Cheaper Fake Followers, and Zynga's Volunteer
